meanings.definition: The highest point or level of something.
meanings.sent1: The mountaintop is the topline of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The topline of the graph shows the peak sales.
meanings.sent3: The topline of the cake was adorned with colorful icing.
meanings.sent4: Her performance reached the topline of excellence.
meanings.sent5: The topline of the skyscraper touched the clouds.

meanings.definition: A summary or overview of key points.
meanings.sent1: The topline of the report highlighted the main findings.
meanings.sent2: Before the meeting, she prepared a topline of the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The topline of the story made it easy to understand.
meanings.sent4: His topline of the book helped others grasp the content quickly.
meanings.sent5: The topline of the article captured the essence of the topic.

meanings.definition: The outline or silhouette of an animal's back.
meanings.sent1: The topline of the horse was sleek and elegant.
meanings.sent2: The topline of the cat showed its graceful posture.
meanings.sent3: The topline of the dog looked like a perfect arch.
meanings.sent4: The topline of the bird was outlined against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The topline of the cow was strong and sturdy.

meanings.definition: The melody or main theme of a piece of music.
meanings.sent1: The topline of the song was catchy and memorable.
meanings.sent2: The topline of the symphony set the tone for the performance.
meanings.sent3: The topline of the tune made everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent4: The topline of the opera lingered in the audience's minds.
meanings.sent5: The topline of the melody was hummed by everyone.
